name: vscode-lab-test-adapter
description: Run your Lab tests in the Sidebar of Visual Studio Code

scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build

labExplorer.cwd.description: The working directory where Lab is run (relative to the workspace folder)

labExplorer.config.description: The location of the labrc config file (relative to the working directory)

labExplorer.env.description: Environment variables to be set when running the tests

labExplorer.debuggerPort.description: The preferred port to use for debugging sessions

labExplorer.nodePath.description: The path to the node executable to use. By default it will attempt to find it on your PATH, if it can't find it or if this option is set to `null`, it will use the one shipped with VS Code

labExplorer.nodeArgv.description: The arguments to the node executable to use. To enable typescript support, install the ts-node npm package and set this property to ["-r", "ts-node/register"]

labExplorer.labPath.description: The path to the lab package to use (relative to the workspace folder). By default (or if this option is set to `null`) it uses a bundled version of @hapi/lab, to use the one installed in your project's node_modules folder, set this option to "node_modules/@hapi/lab"

labExplorer.debuggerConfig.description: The name of a launch configuration to use for debugging sessions

labExplorer.breakOnFirstLine.description: when debugging, inject a breakpoint at the 1st line of the 1st run test

labExplorer.logpanel.description: write diagnotic logs to an output panel

labExplorer.logfile.description: write diagnostic logs to the given file
